creator: felix.yang@oracle.com
text:
This is an enhancement request. I'm attempting to build/test Ant 1.9.7 with latest JDK early access build. It failed immediately at build target with error below.
"build:
    [mkdir] Created dir: /scratch/hudson/jobs/ant-3rd.party.unit.test/workspace/apache-ant-1.9.7-src/build
    [mkdir] Created dir: /scratch/hudson/jobs/ant-3rd.party.unit.test/workspace/apache-ant-1.9.7-src/build/classes
    [mkdir] Created dir: /scratch/hudson/jobs/ant-3rd.party.unit.test/workspace/apache-ant-1.9.7-src/build/lib
    [javac] Compiling 811 source files to /scratch/hudson/jobs/ant-3rd.party.unit.test/workspace/apache-ant-1.9.7-src/build/classes
    [javac] warning: [options] bootstrap class path not set in conjunction with -source 1.5
    [javac] error: Source option 1.5 is no longer supported. Use 1.6 or later.
    [javac] error: Target option 1.5 is no longer supported. Use 1.6 or later.

BUILD FAILED"

According with this item https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8011044, source/target value of "1.5" is no longer supported. So in order to make it works with JDK 9, source/target value must be adjusted accordingly.

Ant 1.9.x is our "long term support for Java5" line and thus must be compiled with -target 1.5. If this means we can't build on Java9, so be it.

Ant 1.10.x - the current master branch - targets Java8 and the source/target switches have been adjusted already,
